page.title: 06RAMBLERS JUBILEE WALK
page.content: The Ramblers Association which was formed in 1935 is a group of people concerned about retaining footpaths who also enjoy walking.The Jubilee walk will be 2,100 miles long and it will wind its way through both England and Wales.Anyone will be welcome to join the walk,about 10-11 miles is covered each day. On the 31st of May 1985 their walk took them through Brockweir and onto Bigsweir.They followed the Offa's Dyke path.Their leader on this stretch of the walk was Mr.Roberts. Rachel Creswick of St.Briavels school joined them on the walk and Mr.Williams,the headmaster spotted them in the Hudnalls wood.All the walkers are signing a commemorative book which will be handed to the Prime Minister at 10,Downing Street.
